required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A First-in-Human Study of JAB-3068 (SHP2 Inhibitor) in Adult Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors in China
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1/2a, Multi-Center, Dose Escalation/Dose Expansion, Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Preliminary Evidence of Antitumor Activity of JAB-3068 in Adult Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 1/2a, open-label, multi-center study of JAB-3068 in Patients with advanced solid tumors.This study has two phases: dose escalation phase and dose expansion phase.

detailed_description.textblock:
Dose escalation study phase is designed to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) according to a 3+3 design and recommended phase II dose (RP2D) and to characterize the safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics (PK) profile of JAB-3068. Other dose regimens may be explored based on the analysis of emerging PK and safety data. at this study phase, JAB-3068 dministered orally once daily (QD) or twice daily (BID) or once every other day (QOD) in 28-day treatment cycles to adult patients with advanced solid tumors,
Dose expansion study phase is designed to evaluate the antitumor activity(ORR and DOR) of JAB-3068 in patients with NSCLC, ESCC and HNSCC.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with dose limiting toxicities
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of Cycle 1 (each cycle is 28 days)
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with dose limiting toxicities (DLTs) in the dose escalation phase. A DLT is defined as an adverse event or abnormal laboratory value assessed as unrelated to disease, disease progression, inter-current illness, or concomitant medications that occurs within the first treatment cycle with JAB-3068.
ORR is defined as the proportion of participants with complete response or partial. the ORR of JAB-3068 in patients with ESCC, NSCLC and HNSCC will be evaluated separately in dose expansion

DOR is defined as the time from the participant's initial objective response (CR or PR) to study drug therapy, to disease progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. The DOR of JAB-3068 in patients with ESCC, NSCLC and HNSCC will be evaluated separately in dose expansion

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: All patients participating in this study will be assessed for incidence and severity of adverse events (AEs) and serious AEs, including changes in laboratory values, vital signs, electrocardiograms, cardiac imaging and ophthalmological assessments
Area under the plasma concentration time curve of JAB-3068
Highest observed plasma concentration of JAB-3068
Time of highest observed plasma concentration of JAB-3068
ORR is defined as the proportion of participants with complete response or partial response (CR+PR) in dose escalation.

DOR is defined as the time from the participant's initial objective response (CR or PR) to study drug therapy, to disease progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first in dose escalation.

arm_group.description: JAB-3068 will be administered orally in the morning following a fast of approximately 6 hours before on PK collection. Patients will continue to fast for approximately 2 hours after the administration of JAB-3068. On non-PK days patients will fast approximately 2 hours before JAB-3068 and continue to fast for approximately 2 hours afterwards.

overall_official.affiliation: Cancer Institute and Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences

facility.name: Cancer Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences
